intro: Leiandra divaricata, commonly known as the variable leiandra, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the spring and summer months. Leiandra divaricata is often found in coastal or sandy soils and is adapted to dry conditions.
